sections.content: Richmond's Victoria Gardens shopping centre is about to get a major upgrade, with co-owners Salta Properties and Vicinity Centres unveiling plans for a new urban village on the site.
The village will have two precincts: the Doonside Precinct, and the River Boulevard Precinct.
The Doonside precinct will sit at the corner of Burnley and Doonside Streets, and will incorporate:

items: 12,030 sqm of new retail and commercial floorspace â€“ including a fresh food market hall
839 new homes in new residential buildings
3,500 square metres of new publicly accessible open spaces
844 new bike spaces and 518 car spaces

sections.content: The River Boulevard Precinct will connect Victoria Gardens to the Yarra River corridor through publicly accessible spaces and thoroughfares, and will include:

items: 6,200 square metres of publicly accessible open space

sections.content: Planning approvals are now being sought through the [Victorian Government's Development Facilitation Program.](https://www.planning.vic.gov.au/permits-and-applications/development-facilitation-program)
